AddressBookProxy * mpAddressBookProxy

Detailed Description

The class provides methods to manage the contacts in the Address Book.

The AddressBook contains all of data about contacts.

The following example demonstrates how to use this AddressBook class.

 createAddressBook() {
     Context context(this);// "this" is mean page instance
     AddressBook*  abook = new AddressBook(context);
     //or
     Addressbook   abook(context);
 }
 addNewRawContacts() {
     ContentValues cv;
     Uri contactsUri = AddressBook::Uri::RAWCONTACTS_CONTENT_URI());
     cv.addValue("account_type","google.com");
     cv.addValue("account_name","terrence");
     Uri newContactsUri = abook.add(contactsUri,cv);
 }

 queryRawContacts() {
     StringArray projection(3);
     projection.replaceAt(RawContacts::_ID(), 0);
     projection.replaceAt(RawContacts::ACCOUNT_NAME(), 1);
     projection.replaceAt(RawContacts::ACCOUNT_TYPE(), 2);

     StringArray whereArgs(1);
     whereArgs.replaceAt(String::valueOf(id), 1);

     String where =  RawContacts::_ID() + "=?");

     Cursor* cursor = aBook.getN(contactsUri, &projection, &where, &whereArgs, NULL);

 }

 updateRawContacts() {
    ContentValues cv;
    cv.addValue(RawContacts::ACCOUNT_TYPE(), "yahoo.com");
    cv.addValue(RawContacts::ACCOUNT_NAME(), "User2");
    int32_t effectRows = -1;
    effectRows = aBook.set(contactsUri, cv, &where, &whereArgs);
 }

 deleteRawContacts() {
    int32_t effectRows = -1;
    effectRows = aBook.remove(contactsUri, &where, &whereArgs);
 }

storage::Cursor* gaia::content::AddressBook::getContactsN ( const base::StringArray *  selection,
const base::String *  where,
const base::StringArray *  whereArgs,
const base::String *  sort 
)

Get all data from Contacts table.

Parameters:
selectionA list of which columns to return. Passing NULL will return all columns, which is discouraged to prevent reading data from storage that isn't going to be used.
whereA filter declaring which rows to return, formatted as an SQL WHERE clause (excluding the WHERE itself). Passing NULL will return all rows for the given table.
whereArgsYou may include ?s in where, which will be replaced by the values from whereArgs, in order that they appear in the where. The values will be bound as StringArray.
sortHow to order the rows, formatted as an SQL ORDER BY clause (excluding the ORDER BY itself). Passing NULL will use the default sort order, which may be unordered.
Returns:
A Cursor pointer, which is positioned before the first entry. Note that Cursors are not synchronized, see the documentation for more details.

const base::String *  where,
const base::StringArray *  whereArgs 
)

Delete rows in the database which uri specified.

Parameters:
uriThe requested uri.
whereA filter declaring which rows to return, formatted as an SQL WHERE clause (excluding the WHERE itself). Passing NULL will return all rows for the given table.
whereArgsYou may include ?s in where, which will be replaced by the values from whereArgs, in order that they appear in the where. The values will be bound as StringArray.
Returns:
The number of rows affected if a whereClause is passed in, 0 otherwise. To remove all rows and get a count pass "1" as the whereClause.
